org.sn.processpool

Class ProcessPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sn.processpool.ProcessPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExecutorService

    public final class ProcessPool
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExecutorService
    An implementation of the ExecutorService. To create a processPool, call ProcessPool.createProcessPool() method.

    Creates a pool of JVM processes to execute the tasks in parallel. The submit method takes the class with main method as one of the parameters. This class can be used in thread safe manner to create and terminate the pool.

    See Also:
    ExecutorService

      • createProcessPool

        public static ExecutorService createProcessPool(java.lang.String poolName,
                                int poolSize,
                                boolean pipedOutput)
        Create the process Pool
        Parameters:
        poolName - Name of the process Pool
        poolSize - Size of the process Pool
        pipedOutput - PipedOutput when set to true redirects the output of pooled processes to main process which creates the pool. Set the flag to false for better performance.
        Returns:
        ExecutorService

      • submit

                               java.lang.String[] args)
        Submit the task to the pool to execute it asynchronously

      • terminateNow

        public void terminateNow()
        Terminates the pool abruptly. All the running tasks will be killed.
        Specified by:
        terminateNow in interface ExecutorService

      • terminate

        public void terminate(long timeout)
        Terminates the pool. Waits till the supplied timeout (timeOutInMillis) expires. setting the timeout to 0 will terminate all the processes abruptly. The currently running tasks will also be terminated without producing the required output.
        Specified by:
        terminate in interface ExecutorService
        Parameters:
        timeOutInMillis - timeout in milliseconds

      • getPoolName

        public java.lang.String getPoolName()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutorService
        Returns the name of the pool. This name is supplied at the time of the pool creation.
        Specified by:
        getPoolName in interface ExecutorService
        Returns:
        Name of the Pool.
